name: Hampton Inn Cincinnati Blue Ash

reviews.text: There was a Birthday party with screaming and running children. The juice machine was broken at breakfast and they ran out of water. The staff shrugged shoulders and laughed when I complained about both. I would chose one of the many other options for the area.
reviews.title: Poor service

reviews.text: My friend and I stayed here for the tennis tournament in Mason, OH. It's 15-20 min. away. Very clean, helpful staff. Free wifi, which I really appreciate. The lobby was clean, great breakfast to start the day. I would definitely come back here.
reviews.title: Comfortable place!

reviews.text: The whole family enjoyed our stay! The hotel room was clean and the entire night was very quite. I slept so well. The room was clean and the temperatures were perfect. Highly recommended! It really made our vacation special. Thanks Hampton Inn!
reviews.title: nice place to stay

reviews.text: The room was very nice and comfortable. The entire place was clean, and nice. I have had better breakfasts at other Hampton Inns, but it was ok.. Just not great.
reviews.title: Nice room, so so breakfast

reviews.text: Quiet room, nice atmosphere, wonderful beds, lovely pillows.
reviews.title: Just fine for us for one night.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was a little hard to find, but nice location and very quiet. Hotel was nice and the guy at the desk was very nice and cheerful! Bed was a little on the hard side, but some may like it like that. Complimentary breakfast wasn't bad either. Free park yourself parking and safe.
reviews.title: Nice hotel in a quiet location

reviews.text: Only draw back is entering the hotel from the main artery. keep an eye out as you have to turn down a secondary road to make your way to the lobby entrance. Professional staff, welcoming experience and a great room value. Recommend it highly for business or pleasure.
reviews.title: Quiet, comfortable and secure

reviews.text: This was a VERY nice Hampton Inn, probably the best I ever stayed in. A little off the beaten path, but probably used by the many offices and Eye center nearby. The staff was very nice and helpful. The rooms clean and kept well stocked. The price was reasonable. The internet worked great. The ladies working the front desk in the morning were so kind. The woman who was taking care of the breakfast was extremely conscientious, keep the place very clean. She was so thoughtful.
reviews.title: Great place!

reviews.text: From Greg at the front desk to Olga in the breakfast area you can count on a great lodging experience at this Hampton Property. It's location also great for evening walks around the business park to get some fresh air.
reviews.title: Great service with a smile

reviews.text: Our first room smelled wet and musty, (room 227). We felt wet/damp just lying on the bed watching TV. When I called the front desk about the issue, they were completely understanding and instantly switched our room - and were just great about it! However, our next room was only less musty but still felt damp. They are in serious need of dehumidifiers!
reviews.title: Other Better Choices nearby

reviews.text: Pros: As with most all Hampton Inns, comfortable beds, clean, and decent WIFI. Restaurants were nearby in a pretty quiet area. Hooray - there was a Power outlet on the bedside table – finally a solution to my greatest travel pet peeve!! (see photo). I'm giving them the benefit of a 4 instead of a 3 on this alone.
reviews.title: Fine for overnight business

reviews.text: Cons: Worst TV system I’ve ever tried to use in a hotel. It had a screwy quirk that had some channels with a dash in them like 18-2 …and when you tried to tune using the remote if you punched in 2 it would count as two 2s… with a dash after it. So trying to tune to channel 200 was impossible because you hit 2 and a 0 you would given 22-0 which didn’t exist. Desk clerk was just as confused as I was. Fridge was so load and clunking that I unplugged it. TV and desk were separated by the fridge/microwave stand so impossible to see the TV while working at the desk.
reviews.title: Housekeeping Issues

reviews.text: I arrived at Hampton Inn Blue Ash Oh. Sat. 9/28. Greg, the front desk agent was very professional and helpful. Upon checking into the room, there were stink bugs in the room, which I could understand that these pests are out of the control of the Hotel. I took a shower and was standing in ankle deep water, because the tub was not draining. I also noticed someone had written a message on the mirror which appeared when the steam coated the mirror. Breakfast items were not replenished. I was trying to toast a bagel and the toaster kept popping the bagel up. I asked the attendant if something was wrong with the toaster and she just said she never used it. I went to the front desk and explained my concerns. Julie the front desk agent apologized. I started to walk away, and the asked for the 100% guarantee. She said because I was at the employee rate and paid cash, she could not do anything, I would have to call the Manager the next. day. This is not how the Hampton 100% guarantee works.
reviews.title: Not Fresh

reviews.text: The room smell was very stale and musty. We tried to air it out but it did not work. It seemed to be coming from the vent as well.Poor signage at road which made locating exact spot a little difficult, even with GPS. The housekeeping young lady seemed to resent it when i asked for more shampoo after we were in the pool. The pool and jacuzzi was nice and enjoyable. Would like to have had a fresh nights rest without the odor.
reviews.title: Not My Favorite Hampton

reviews.text: I stayed here for a business trip. My room (at the end of the hall on the second floor) was not great. I walked in and was hit in the face with a damp, moldy smell. It was not pleasant. The air conditioning unit looked like it had something growing on the vent. I found a dead spider in the bathroom. It was very small, granted, but when I'm in a hotel the last thing I want to be reminded of is bugs. The countertop in the bathroom was cracked and looked old. The tub had chips around the drain. The ceiling looked like it had dust or mold on it, it was hard to tell.
reviews.title: Hampton Inn Blue Ash, OHIO

reviews.text: I've stayed at hotel quite a few times, and the staff is friendly, and always accommodating. The rooms are clean, the linens smell fresh, and the beds are very comfortable. The location is close to a major highway, and lots of places to dine nearby, some within walking distance.
reviews.title: Clean, comfortable, and Quiet

reviews.text: Our family loves Hampton Inn. But this particular Hampton Inn wasn't all that great. We had requested 3
reviews.title: Just ok

reviews.text: 'non smoking' rooms and when we got there, there were NONE available (we had 3 families so needed 3 rooms). Not good at all. I have asthma and my grandson, to be in another room, has asthma so staying in smoking rooms was awful, to say the least. We were there for 3 nights so they got 'no smoking rooms' for all of us the next day, but the damage was done. My asthma had flared up and the next few days were kind of ruined..... The only other complaint was the pool. The water was so warm - and SALTY- that you couldn't say in it more than about 10 minutes. You'd expect that from the sauna, but not the pool. I will say that the staff was very friendly and tried to be helpful, but we won't stay there again. Definitely NOT a good experience.
reviews.title: Great Staff & Location

reviews.text: Sunday evening when I arrived Greg greeted me nicely at the front desk, asked if he could suggest any place for dinner, I accepted his offer. He suggested "City BBQ," coming from NashVegas I know good BBQ. Monday morning greeted by Ms. Olga and her nice breakfast. The room very clean and spacious (2 Queen Room). Noticed the property is off the beaten path so nice for evening walks. Greg & Olga went beyond the call of duty. Thanks Cecil E
reviews.title: Moldy room, unresponsive management

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Have been a long time Hampton Inn customer and was very disappointed in our family's stay. When we got to our room we were met with a moldy smell. A call to the front desk was not helpful, couldn't move rooms -supposedly all were booked, but we witnessed someone come into the front desk shortly after we checked in and get a room, and it was evident they didn't have a reservation. We asked for fans or some other way of ventilating the rooms - nothing. We were offered some kind of scented spray to mask the smell, but smell is only part of the concern. Allergies are a bigger part so it was an anxious night of worrying who might get sick. We were stuck with a smelly room and we didn't sleep well. Closer inspection showed mold growing in a few places (see pictures) - namely in the vents on the air conditioner, around the shower and on the bathroom ceiling. It was disgusting. and couldn't be healthy. Also, was very disappointed in the front desk staff being unable/unwilling to help us improve or resolve the issue.
reviews.title: A trip to remember

aka: Hampton Inn Cincinnati Blue Ash Hotel
